results.title: Atlantic trawler
results.creator_credit: Frank Sainsbury, John Taylor, Great Britain. Ministry of Information and Realist Films
results.brief_description: Life aboard a fishing trawler off the West Coast of England, under arduous and dangerous war-time conditions. Shows the daily life of the crew at sea, consisting of fishing day and night and hauling every three or four hours. Also looks at life on land as women repair nets, clean fish and greet their returning husbands. Tragically, the steam trawler ‘Hondo’ on which this documentary was filmed returned to sea with a different crew and was lost with all hands. Photographed by A. E. Jenkins, Chick Fowle and Cyril Phillips. Sound by Ken Cameron and Jock May. Music by William Alwyn.

results.title: Atlantic Isles
results.brief_description: Compares the life of people in the Shetland Isles, where the climate is extreme, with that of the people of the Channel Isles who enjoy more equable weather. Shetland Isles (Mainland, Unst, Yell, Foula, Lerwick): crofter’s house, vegetable growing, Shetland ponies, weaving, knitting fair-isle woollens, fishing. Channel Isles (Alderney, Guernsey, Sark, Jersey, St Peter Port, St Hellier): tomato growing in glasshouses, potato growing, cattle breeding, historic buildings.

results.title: Athletes (Italian)
results.brief_description: The growth of track and field competition in Australia is studied, junior events as well as international competitions. We see the work being done to encourage youngsters to participate in track and field events. The film contains some very excellent slow motion sequences of athletes performing at their peak, which evoke a strange sort of fluid beauty in this otherwise rather harsh world of sweat and strain.

results.title: Athens and ancient Greece
results.brief_description: Ancient Greece and 25 of the most significant structures and monuments, as originally built, come alive as Greek customs and daily life are revealed through computer graphics, archival film and classic art. Tour the Acropolis in the 5th century B.C., gaze at the State of Athena and the Parthenon, the pride and joy of the Athenians. Walk the Agora, Theatre of Dionysius (home of the Olympic Games) and the Temple of Zeus. Stand before Delphis Temple of Apollo where the oracle spoke. Travel to Mycenae, City of Agamemnon; Santorini and Atlantis, the legendary lost continent.

results.title: Ataturk: the rise of the Turkish Republic (Turkish Version)
results.creator_credit: Marianna Norris, Morton Schindel and Sim Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the history of the Turkish people and the role of Ataturk in its rise to nationhood in the twentieth century. Narration is in the Turkish language.

results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 3
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith, Education Development Center and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Center. In this part, work begins on a spacious community igloo. When the men return to their hunt, the women continue with their work and play games with the children. A seal is dragged into the igloo to be shared by everyone including the dogs, who are called in to clean up. (Award: Parno)

results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith, Education Development Center and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. This film show life at the campsite. Children amuse themselves with makeshift toys. Women tend their children, make clothes, and repair the igloos. When the men return with their catch, everyone goes inside where work, story-telling and games occupy each one’s time. Award: Parno. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith, Education Development Center and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. In late winter when the cold is severe, the inuit stop their trek and make camp. The men cut blocks for an igloo while the women shovel the site. During the day, the men sit patiently on the ice, waiting for seals. (Award: Parno)
